title: Friday, 17th February, 2017

Unilever PLC (ULVR:LSE): Last: 3,383, up 35 (+1.05%), High: 3,384, Low: 3,343, Volume: 870.24k

PM11:28am

BE11:28am

£100bn

PM11:29am

Wow

BE11:29am

BE11:30am

Lazard and Centerview are rumoured to be involved on the Kraft and Unilever sides respectively.

BE11:30am

Have I said raw? Holy hell, RAW RAW RAW RAW

11:30 am
PM11:31am

That was taken as a given Bryce

PM11:31am

But I've worked with you a number of years -- and you don't print stuff like this lightly

PM11:31am

(That's my job)

11:31 am
BE11:31am

Sure, but note, this is a market rumour. It's what's being talked about by people who are often barking up the right trees.

PM11:32am

Kraft-Heinz for Unilever

PM11:32am

Wanna give it a bandit reading?

11:32 am
PM11:32am

We could dust one off

BE11:32am

No, I don't. People get confused and think the specific numbers represent actual people rather than grades of people.

PM11:33am

Censored

11:32 am
BE11:33am

What I can say is that we're putting it out here as it's clearly in the market already, as evidenced by the many bandits taking an interest in the situation this week.

BE11:33am

And .... well, that's what the rumour is. It's Heinz-Kraft at £40 or thereabouts.

BE11:33am

There are many potential outcomes here.

11:33 am
BE11:34am

The first is that it's entirely wrong and it'll get denied.

BE11:34am

the second is that it's entirely wrong and there will be no comment whatsoever.

PM11:34am

Much discussion on the right about regulatory situation

11:34 am
BE11:34am

The third option is that it's right and they'll go pens down because of the leak and deny after that.

PM11:34am

Chocolate bars, baked beans, washing powder...

PM11:35am

11:35 am

PM11:35am

3423

My job is to report what's moving stocks. That's the story that's been moving Unilever. We've made sufficient calls over the past 24 hours to note this publicly without imagining that we're doing anything other than disseminating a rumour from a small clique to a larget audience.

BE11:41am

I'm of the opinion that, in running a clean market, sunlight is the best disinfectant.

11:40 am

Inmarsat PLC (ISAT:LSE): Last: 616.50, down 34 (-5.23%), High: 639.50, Low: 613.00, Volume: 1.92m
BE11:48am

We have UBS selling.

11:48 am
BE11:48am

Perhaps somewhat belatedly, because it's already been smashed post management trying to shape the consensus earlier in the year.

BE11:49am

Not -- not! -- guiding down!

BE11:49am

UBS has one of its evidence lab thingmies.

11:49 am
BE11:49am

Long term, satcom's well positioned. Short term, it's a money sink.

BE11:50am

In partnership with UBS Evidence Lab, we conducted a proprietary survey of 49 fleet
communications procurement managers, representing a combined spend of more than
$1bn and more than 10,000 vessels. The results of this survey, combined with
conversations with industry experts and detailed analysis of the dynamics of the
Maritime business unit (50% of group revenue), lead us to forecast Maritime EBITDA
c4-9% below the market and consensus 2018-2020E. We expect consensus estimates
to come down over the next 12-18 months, but note that we do see a wide range of
potential outcomes for Inmarsat, as reflected in our upside/downside scenarios.

BE11:50am

n our base-case scenario we expect Inmarsat – possibly at FY16 results – to stop
growing the dividend until it is covered by EFCF. We believe that the market is pricing
in continued growth in the dividend near-term, similar to consensus at +4-5% in 2017
and 2018. We believe this change in the dividend policy will allow Inmarsat to invest in
its substantial long-term opportunities and avoid pressuring the balance sheet while
EFCF generation is limited and uncertain. We also expect Inmarsat to drop FY18
revenue guidance.

11:50 am
BE11:51am

Inmarsat could announce a wholesale deal with China for the capacity of the I-5 F4
satellite around its launch in Q2/Q3 2017 (though timing is uncertain). This could add
80p to our upside-case valuation. Further aviation contracts with major airlines and
achieving aviation milestones would boost confidence on the potential for Aviation. We
also watch for developments around Ligado Networks' FCC approval (+160p to our
upside case). We note that Inmarsat could benefit from interest from a strategic
investor, as reported in August 2016 by The Guardian. Our upside case points to
1,120p fair value per share.

BE11:51am

Cuts to our estimates lead to our DCF-based price target falling 32%. On UBS
estimates, at c650p and 2017E multiples excluding Ligado Networks, Inmarsat trades
on 8x EV/EBITDA, a –3% EFCF yield, and a 6.5% dividend yield. Each 1% strengthening
in GBP relative to USD leads to a 1.4% reduction in our PT, all else being equal.

(Bloomberg) -- Unilever shares head for biggest gain since Sept. 2 after the FT’s Alphaville blog reported a potential approach from Kraft Heinz, with private equity firm 3G and Warren Buffett said to be involved on the financing side.
Price mentioned ~4000p/share
Offer said to be structured largely in cash
Lazard said to be advising Kraft, Centerview for Unilever

A bit of ING on the matter

11:55 am
BE11:55am

Thumbs up

PM11:55am

It looks like the UK consumer’s remarkable post-Brexit resilience is finally coming to an end.

That’s the message from the latest retail sales data, which excluding fuel, fell by 0.2% in January. This takes the YoY rate to just 2.6%, down from close to 8% in November. This corroborates other survey evidence from the British Retail Consortium, which suggested the high street had a tough time during the January sales.

To us, this is further evidence that the squeeze on household incomes is starting to weigh on consumer sentiment. Food and fuel prices are soaring, and as the effect of a weaker pound continues to feed through, we expect inflation to break above 3% in the second half of this year.

At the same time, wage growth is starting to moderate and the employment outlook is, at best, looking subdued. When you put all this together, real incomes look set to start falling and it could be an increasingly tough 2017 for the UK consumer. Recent consumer confidence data has shown that sentiment has been dipping, having rebounded from the immediate post-Brexit decline.

This is a key reason why we expect the Bank of England to stay on hold through this year and next, despite recent commentary suggesting they have limited tolerance of higher inflation.

AstraZeneca

BE12:01pm

Lynparza meets primary endpoint in OLYMPIAD

BE12:01pm

Good news, though only incremental really.

12:01 pm
AstraZeneca PLC (AZN:LSE): Last: 4,629, up 104.05 (+2.30%), High: 4,641, Low: 4,534, Volume: 1.04m
BE12:02pm

We all know the big event facing AZN, because we've banged on about it on here for months.

BE12:02pm

Here's Caz on Lynparza

12:02 pm
BE12:02pm

This morning AZN announced positive Lynparza Breast cancer results from a head to head Phase III trial
(OLYMPIAD) trial comparing Lynparza 300mg versus physician’s choice chemotherapy, in 1st- to 3rd-line
germline BRCA mutation positive metastatic breast cancer patients (5-10% of breast cancer). Astra reported that
Lynparza treated patients showed a statistically significant and clinically meaningful improvement in
progression free survival compared with those who received chemotherapy.
JPMe Lynparza Breast as a $360m peak sales opportunity, noting that BRCA mutations are observed in 5-
10% of breast cancer patients. We currently include Lynparza in our model at 60% probability, worth c.70p per
share, 1.5% of our NPV. Removing our risk adjustment would add a further c.50p or 1% to our NPV. We
believe the market has taken a fairly cautious view into the chances of success for this trial, with AZN having
made few encouraging comments about this particular trial ahead of the read-out, and with Abbvie’s Phase II
BROCADE trial of their PARP, veliparib, as a chemo add-on in breast cancer having reported negative results
in December 2016.

BE12:04pm

So, approval by the end of the year and peak sales in the BRCAm+ indication of $360m in 2025.

BE12:04pm

Nice, but no big whoop.

BE12:09pm

17th February 2017

The Kraft Heinz Company ("Kraft") notes the recent speculation regarding a possible combination of Kraft and Unilever plc / Unilever NA ("Unilever"). Kraft confirms that it has made a comprehensive proposal to Unilever about combining the two groups to create a leading consumer goods company with a mission of long-term growth and sustainable living. While Unilever has declined the proposal, we look forward to working to reach agreement on the terms of a transaction. There can be no certainty that any further formal proposal will be made to the Board of Unilever or that an offer will be made at all or as to the terms of any transaction.

This announcement does not constitute an announcement of a firm intention to make an offer under Rule 2.7 of the UK City Code on Takeovers and Mergers (the "Code"). In accordance with Rule 2.6(a) of the Code, Kraft must, by not later than 5.00 p.m. (London time) on 17 March 2017, either announce a firm intention to make an offer for Unilever in accordance with Rule 2.7 of the Code or announce that it does not intend to make an offer for Unilever in which case the announcement will be treated as a statement to which Rule 2.8 of the Code applies. This deadline will only be extended with the consent of Unilever and the UK Takeover Panel in accordance with Rule 2.6(c) of the Code.

In accordance with Rule 2.9 of the Code, Kraft discloses that, as at the date of this announcement, it has 1,216,816,890 shares of common stock par value $0.01 each ("Kraft Stock") in issue and traded on NASDAQ under the banner KHC. The International Securities Identification number for the Kraft Stock is US 5007541064

This is a press release by Kraft pursuant to the provisions of Section 4 Paragraph 3 of the Decree on Public Takeover Bids (Besluit Openbare Biedingen Wft) of the Netherlands in connection with a potential voluntary public offer by Kraft for all the issued and outstanding ordinary shares in the capital of Unilever. This announcement does not constitute an offer, or any solicitation of any offer, to buy or subscribe for any securities. Any offer will be made only by means of an offer memorandum.

A further statement will be made as appropriate.

English and Dutch versions of this press release will be posted on www.kraftheinzcompany.com
